content.question: Block <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with mass <math alttext="m sub Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> falls onto and sticks to block <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which is attached to a vertical spring, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. A short time later, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the blocks are momentarily at rest. At that moment, block <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> exerts a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub down" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>down</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> on block <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and block <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> exerts a force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub up" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>up</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> on block <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly relates <math alttext="F sub up" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>up</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="F sub down" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>down</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="m sub Y, end sub, g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at the instant shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub up equals F sub down, close parenthesis, is greater than m sub Y, end sub, g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>up</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>down</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub up equals m sub y, end sub, g, close parenthesis, is greater than F sub down" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>up</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>down</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m sub y, end sub, g, is greater than F sub up, which is greater than F sub down" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>up</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>down</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub up equals F sub down, which equals m sub y, end sub, g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>up</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>down</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub up equals F sub down, close parenthesis, is greater than m sub Y, end sub, g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>up</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>down</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
